item.title: Where to Get All Spool Fragments in Silksong
item.description:
There are 18 Spool Fragments in Hollow Knight: Silksong , and players who want to maximize the amount of Silk that Hornet can carry will need to find them all. Additionally, finding all 18 Spool Fragments is a requirement for earning the Extended achievement. This gives players an additional reason to collect every Spool Fragment in Silksong , and this guide is here to assist with that undertaking.

While many Spool Fragments can be collected without using all of Hornet's abilities, it is recommended that players unlock Cling Grip , Clawline , and the Faydown Cloak before making a concerted effort to claim all these collectibles. Additionally, it is recommended that players unlock all area maps in Silksong before going after Spool Fragments, as that will make finding them much easier.

Bone Bottom Spool Fragments in Silksong

Spool Fragment #1

The first Spool Fragment is in an alcove above Bone Bottom. To reach it, players should follow the path shown on the preceding map, briefly passing through the left side of the Marrow, and break through the wall that they find at the marked position.

Weavenest Alta Spool Fragments in Silksong

Spool Fragment #2

After unlocking Needolin , players should use this ability to open the locked gate on the right side of the Mosso Grotto. Weavenest Alta is beyond that gate, and the preceding map shows the route to the Spool Fragment that is in the area.

Deep Docks Spool Fragments in Silksong

Spool Fragment #3

Follow the path shown in the preceding map to reach the first Spool Fragment in Deep Docks, which is at the top of a room with a floor made of embers.

Spool Fragment #4

Start by obtaining one of the Simple Keys in Silksong , and then use it to unlock the door in Deep Docks. Traverse the area beyond that door, following the route shown on the preceding map, to reach a Spool Fragment.

Players will encounter a door along this route that can only be opened with Silksong 's Clawline ability.

Greymoor Spool Fragments in Silksong

Spool Fragment #5

There is a Spool Fragment in a high alcove in Greymoor, and players can use the route shown on the preceding map to reach it.

Bellhart Spool Fragments in Silksong

Spool Fragment #6

Complete Silksong 's My Missing Courier Wish, which comes from the Wish Board in Bellhart . Then purchase the Spool Fragment from Frey, the vendor to the right of the Wish Board, for 270 Rosaries.

Blasted Steps Spool Fragments in Silksong

Spool Fragment #7

Players can purchase a Spool Fragment from Grindle in the Blasted Steps. It costs 680 Rosaries.

Spool Fragment #8

After finding 14 Lost Fleas in Silksong , speak with Flea Master Mooshka to earn a Spool Fragment. The Flea Caravan should be on the path between the Blasted Steps and the Grand Gate at this stage of the game.

Grand Gate Spool Fragments in Silksong

Spool Fragment #9

Climb to the top of the scale room in the Grand Gate to claim this Spool Fragment.

Choral Chambers Spool Fragments in Silksong

Spool Fragment #10

Complete the Lost Merchant Wish in Silksong , and then purchase the Spool Fragment from Jubilana in Songclave for 500 Rosaries.

Spool Fragment #11

Complete Silksong 's Balm for the Wounded Wish, which can be accepted at the Songclave Wish Board , to earn a Spool Fragment.

Cogwork Core Spool Fragments in Silksong

Spool Fragment #12

Head to the bottom-right corner of the Cogwork Core to find a Spool Fragment.

The Slab Spool Fragments in Silksong

Spool Fragment #13

While this Spool Fragment may technically be on the right edge of Mount Fay, it is accessed by following this route in the Slab.

This guide to reaching the Slab in Silksong will help players access this location.

Underworks Spool Fragments in Silksong

Spool Fragment #14

The Underworks' first Spool Fragment is in a room just beneath the area's elevator .

Spool Fragment #15

The Underworks' second Spool Fragment is on the right side of the area, though getting there can be a bit tricky. Indeed, the path to this collectible is fairly long, requiring players to pass through the Cogwork Core and the Whispering Vaults. This path, which can start at Songclave, is shown on the preceding map, and the Spool Fragment is in an alcove at the bottom of the final chute.

Whiteward Spool Fragments in Silksong

Spool Fragment #16

This Spool Fragment is at the bottom of the elevator chute in Whiteward. To reach it, players must get under the elevator, and here is how that is done:

  1. Ride the elevator to the bottom.
  2. Follow the path shown on the preceding map to get back to the top of the chute without using the elevator.
  3. Stand on the button to activate the elevator, quickly fall into the chute, and move onto a path at the chute's midpoint, allowing the elevator to pass.
  4. Fall to the bottom of the chute to claim the Spool Fragment.

Memorium Spool Fragments in Silksong

Spool Fragment #17

After using double jump to reach Silksong 's Memorium area, follow the path shown on the preceding map to grab a Spool Fragment.

High Halls Spool Fragments in Silksong

Spool Fragment #18

Start at the bench in the top-left corner of the Choral Chambers, and then follow the path to reach a Spool Fragment at the top of High Halls.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077: Why Project Orion Needs to Preserve the Corpo Lifepath Above All Others
item.description:
It's not yet clear what CD Projekt Red wants to achieve with Project Orion , the mysterious sequel to Cyberpunk 2077 , but one can only assume that it will be an ambitious project. Not only will it follow a critically acclaimed, one-of-a-kind action-RPG, but it will also be something of a possible redemption for CDPR, which lost so much of its goodwill in the wake of Cyberpunk 2077 's historically disastrous launch.

Untethered from the myriad technical and PR issues of the first Cyberpunk 2077 , Project Orion has a chance to better realize the IP's potential. Much like The Witcher games before it, Cyberpunk 2077 excels at storytelling, but it perhaps could have benefited from a firmer focus in some areas. For instance, the Lifepath feature, which was heavily touted as an ambitious, replay-value-enhancing mechanic ahead of launch, wound up being a bit underbaked and ineffectual, ultimately having very little impact on a given playthrough. This is something that Project Orion could improve, but whatever changes the sequel makes to Lifepaths, it ought to hone in on at least one from its predecessor.

Project Orion: Why the Corpo Lifepath Might Be the Most Important One to Get Right

The Corpo Lifepath Is Cyberpunk 2077's Most Unique and Interesting

Cyberpunk 2077 has three Lifepaths: Nomad, Streetkid, and Corpo. Streetkid plants V's roots in the seedy underbelly of Night City; this is fitting, considering V's demeanor, personality, and street smarts. Nomad makes a lot of sense too, especially for those role-playing as a more rebellious, subversive V. By comparison, the Corpo Lifepath doesn't smoothly slot into the rest of the Cyberpunk 2077 story, but it's arguably the most fascinating place to start.

In both Night City and Cyberpunk 2077 's broader world, corporations are king. The likes of Arasaka and Militech have far more power and influence than any politician or governing body, and with virtually no oversight, this power has gone unchecked for years. In other words, the United States of Cyberpunk 2077 is a corporatocracy, a society crafted by corporations, for corporations. Since these corporate entities are essentially Cyberpunk 2077 's main antagonists, there's not much opportunity to see behind their multi-story, chrome-plated walls. This is where an improved Corpo Lifepath could come into play in Project Orion .

Cyberpunk 2077 's Corpo Lifepath arguably features the best prologue, letting players explore the interior of a corporate building—a space they can't access again for the rest of the game.

How Project Orion Could Offer a Better, More Poignant Corpo Lifepath

Much of Cyberpunk 's most relevant and powerful social commentary is delivered through the lens of its in-universe corporations, but the fact that it's a video game means that a lot of this commentary is either replaced or drowned out by high-octane action. It's much more fun to shoot down Arasaka drones than to listen to thinly veiled post-mortems on the American Dream. But linking Project Orion 's protagonist to one such company, even if it's only through an optional feature like a Lifepath, could open the door to more nuanced storytelling in this regard.

Maybe selecting the Corpo Lifepath in Project Orion could draw back the curtain on corporations' legislative powers, better explaining how they maintain their independence from and dominance over the NUSA. Project Orion 's protagonist, if they start as a Corpo, could even have a hand in shaping some of this legislation, or engaging in some underhanded, cutthroat corporate politics. Getting a better look at the day-to-day operations of these sinister corporations is the best part of the Corpo Lifepath in Cyberpunk , so Project Orion shouldn't be shy about the same subject matter.

item.title: New Game Is Like Skate, But With a Scooter
item.description:
ScootX , a sandbox-style scooter game, is launching on Xbox next week. The early access up-and-comer aims to deliver a Skate -like focus on feel, flow, and physics, just with a kick scooter rather than a skateboard.

ScootX is the latest title from Mash Games, a North Vancouver-based studio that has so far been exclusively focused on making BMX video games, having released PIPE by BMX Streets and BMX Streets in 2018 and 2024, respectively. Billed as the first-ever fully physics-driven scooter sim, ScootX originally launched in Steam Early Access on July 4, 2025.

ScootX Locks Down an Xbox Release Date

Two and a half months later, the indie sports sim is ready to make the jump to consoles, specifically the Xbox Series X/S. It will release on September 19 as part of the Game Preview program, becoming the first Mash Games-produced title to debut on Microsoft's current-gen Xbox consoles. The Canadian developer has not yet disclosed console pricing. If the Steam version is any indication, the physics-driven kick scooter sim is likely to retail for $19.99. The ScootX Xbox Store page is already live, though it offers limited information. The listing doesn't even mention a release date, which was confirmed separately by Microsoft, as part of the company's latest weekly roundup of upcoming Xbox launches.

Much of ScootX has been designed in service of experimentation. "There's no wrong way to ride," the game's official synopsis reads, promising consistent and meaningful progression no matter the playstyle. That flexibility is another thing that it has in common with the early access version of the Skate reboot, which is also launching in a few days' time, on September 16.​​​​​​

The ScootX Xbox Series X/S port is likely to arrive with all the updates that the game has already received on Valve's storefront over the summer. The latest of those materialized on August 30, adding an entirely new map. A day before that, ScootX added several new tricks and a few revamped animations.

There's no wrong way to ride.

Dozens of Games Coming to Xbox Next Week

ScootX is one of over three dozen games that are coming to the Xbox Series X/S during the week of September 15. The forthcoming releases will kick off with co-op adventure LEGO Voyagers and psychological horror title BrokenLore: LOW , followed by Football Heroes League , Goat Out of Hell , Frame Cat , and Parasol Superstars —all of which are scheduled to drop on September 16. Other highlights from this mid-September 2025 batch of Xbox games include puzzler Bio Block and the Frostpunk 2 console port, both of which arrive on September 18, followed by Car Mechanic Shop Simulator and the early access version of EA Sports FC 26 a day later.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077 2.31 May Be a Blessing and a Curse for a Future 2.4 Update
item.description:
Even after five years, Cyberpunk 2077 still continues to introduce extra content, and the game's most recent update, 2.3, was a pleasant surprise revealed over the summer. Released back in July, update 2.3 brought strong features like AutoDrive, an overhauled Photo Mode, and four new vehicles to the table, proving that Cyberpunk 2077 still has plenty of room to grow.

In the past, CD Projekt Red has made it seem like Cyberpunk 2077 's post-launch support is over, but that clearly hasn't been the case. After the dystopian RPG received its major 2.0 update back in 2023, it marked a major turning point for the game, and as CD Projekt Red continues to add content and features, it's made many players assume that more is on the way. However, after the recent 2.31 patch, a potential 2.4 update may not be in the cards.

Update 2.3's four new vehicles included the Yaiba ARV-Q340 Semimaru, the Chevillon Legatus 450 Aquila, the Rayfield Caliburn "Mordred", and the Yaiba ASM-R250 Muramasa motorcycle.

Cyberpunk 2077's 2.31 Patch Could Spell Trouble for Update 2.4

What Does Patch 2.31 Include?

  • Various vehicle fixes, including an update to AutoDrive.
  • Bug fixes and updates to Photo Mode
  • Fixes to various missions

While these quality of life changes are great, it also makes one wonder why they weren't saved for a future update. This could potentially be a signal that CD Projekt Red has no intention of bringing a 2.4 update to Cyberpunk 2077 after all. Of course, this is purely speculation, but the 2.31 patch isn't exactly introducing anything groundbreaking, so it could have easily been included in the hoped-for 2.4.

It's important to note that CD Projekt Red has made no indication that a 2.4 update is in the works, but as the developer continues to bring surprise changes to the game, it has potentially filled some players with false expectations regarding ongoing updates. After the developer was able to bring Cyberpunk 2077 back from the ashes of its notorious launch, many have been eagerly awaiting more from CD Projekt Red, which makes these unexpected updates that much more intriguing.

CD Projekt Red is currently hard at work on The Witcher 4 . There has yet to be a release date announced for the game, but speculation has pointed to a potential 2027 launch. Cyberpunk 2077 's sequel, codenamed Project Orion, also officially entered pre-production earlier this year.

After the dystopian RPG received its major 2.0 update back in 2023, it marked a major turning point for the game.

After Update 2.3, Theories About 2.4 Quickly Spread

When 2.3 was launched a few months ago, it didn't take long for players to notice that CD Projekt Red seemingly included some extra smaller features, with many assuming that they were hints at future content. One of these specific changes that players locked onto were ads for an in-game casino.

The North Oak Casino & Country Club has always been present in the base game, but it's impossible for players to actually reach. The thought of a brand-new casino area in Cyberpunk 2077 is thrilling, but it remains to be seen if the new in-game ads for it are hinting at 2.4's content or were simply included to freshen up Night City's advertisements.

There's also the possibility that these casino ads could be leaving little breadcrumbs that hint at what to expect in Cyberpunk 2077 's sequel. Right now, there's no way to know for sure, but as time passes, it will be interesting to see if CD Projekt still has a few tricks up its sleeve or if the team is ready to move on from Cyberpunk 2077 for good.

Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world action-adventure from the creators of The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt, CD Projekt Red.

Set in Night City, a megalopolis obsessed with power, glamour and body modification, you play as V, a mercenary outlaw going after a one-of-a-kind implant that is the key to immortality.

Upgraded with next-gen in mind and featuring free additional content, customize your character and playstyle as you take on jobs, build a reputation, and unlock upgrades.

The relationships you forge and the choices you make will shape the story and the world around you. Legends are made here. What will yours be?

item.title: Roblox: Savannah Life Codes (September 2025)
item.description:
Savannah Life is a well-made RPG with great graphics, mechanics, and a concept that you don't often find in other Roblox games. Here, you will have to survive as an animal, predator, or herbivore in a huge savannah filled with dangers and other players who can also pose a threat.

To dominate this world, you need to climb the evolutionary ladder from herbivore to predator as quickly as possible, but first you need a lot of currency, which is not easy to get. Luckily, you can redeem Savannah Life codes that will bring you a bunch of freebies, including currency that you can spend on the desired upgrades.

Updated September 13, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Savannah Life currently has a few working codes that you can use to claim extra Coins. These rewards give you a quick boost to spend in the game and can help you progress a little faster. Since the codes provide different amounts, it’s worth redeeming each one while they are still active. Be sure to check back later, as more codes may be released in the future.

All Savannah Life Codes

Working Savannah Life Codes

  • HYENA - Redeem this code to get 275 Coins. (NEW)
  • BACON_AND_EGGS - Redeem this code to get 250 Coins.
  • FAST_CAT - Redeem this code to get 250 Coins.
  • MONKEY - Redeem this code to get 300 Coins.

Expired Savannah Life Codes

  • THE_KING - Redeem this code to get 275 Coins.
  • CROCODILE - Redeem this code to get 325 Coins.
  • I_BELIEVE_I_CAN_FLY - Redeem this code to get 275 Coins.
  • CLIMBING_CAT - Redeem this code to get 250 Coins.
  • RHINO - Redeem this code to get 350 Coins.
  • LONG_NECK - Redeem this code to get 450 Coins.
  • CUTE_DOG - Redeem this code to get 275 Coins.
  • FREE_PRESENT - Redeem this code to get 300 Coins.
  • MOO_DENG - Redeem this code to get 400 Coins.
  • MUFASA - Redeem this code to get 300 Coins.
  • RELEASE - Redeem this code to get 250 Coins.

As mentioned above, redeeming Savannah Life codes will bring you a bunch of useful things that will greatly help you progress in the game, especially if you are a beginner. It's worth noting that each of them has a certain expiration date, so if you don't want to miss out on rewards, redeem them as soon as possible.

How to Redeem Codes for Savannah Life

Redeeming Savannah Life codes will not be difficult for you, especially if you have done it before in other Roblox games. But if you're a beginner or don't understand how the Savannah Life redemption system works, here's a step-by-step guide to help you with that:

  • Launch Savannah Life .
  • In the main menu, you will see a list of buttons and options. Among them, interact with the last one which says Codes.
  • This will open the redemption menu. There will be an input field where you will need to enter one of the working codes from the list above.
  • Lastly, hit the Enter key to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, a notification will appear on the screen with a list of rewards received.

How to Get More Savannah Life Codes

To find more Savannah Life codes, all you need to do is visit the game's official social media. Here, along with other content, developers often share Roblox codes, so be careful not to miss them.

  • Official Savannah Life Roblox group.
  • Official Savannah Life Discord server.
  • Official Savannah Life YouTube channel.
